cleaned_text: Introduction Photodermatosis (plural photodermatoses) is a skin condition caused by exposure to Ultraviolet (UV) light and can cause different types of symptoms like itching, swelling, redness, and blisters. In this blog, we will cover what is the most common photodermatosis, how long it lasts, the best Photodermatosis Ayurvedic Treatment, and some tips. What is the Most Common Photodermatosis? There are various types of photodermatosis, but [Polymorphic Light Eruption](https://www.iafaforallergy.com/blog/get-rid-of-pmle-rash-fast/) (PLE) is the most common and widespread. PLE mostly emerges in spring or early summer when skin is exposed to sunlight. PLE appears as red, itchy bumps in the skin after exposure to UV light. PLE commonly affects fair skin and blue eyes, people. How Long Does Photodermatosis Last? The duration of photodermatosis varies from person to person. In some people, it may last a few hours with proper treatment and sun protection. In other people, it may last several days and even some weeks. Severity also varies from person to person. If severity increases please consult an Ayurvedic doctor as soon as possible.
